result.execSummary:
The defendant Felicia M Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felicia M Jacobson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Felicia M Jacobson in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:27 AM. All parties have summary, no inaccuracies. State - jail credit 121 and will stipulate to that amount. State - follow DOC recommendation of 6 months in FC jail. Joy makes statement. State makes statement.  Jacobson makes statement, remoreseful. Court has considered all statements and sentences to the following: 121 days in FC jail and gives jail credit for 121 days. Appeal rights given
Defendant's Voluntary Request to a Pre-Trial without an Attorney

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Felicia M Jacobson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:59 AM. Jacobson appears without an attorney again. State - have resolved the matter without an attorney - met with the defendant on 5/16/16 - DRI #1, plead as alleged to count #2, amend #3 to 1st offense possession of THC, DRI #4, counts #2 and #3 - 18 months probation with conditions and costs. Jacobson agrees. Recess to fill out waiver of right to attorney and plea questionnaire (10:00 AM). Recalled at 10:35 AM with same appearances. Court has waiver of right to attorney and plea questionnaire. Court reads what the defendant is currently charged with. Jacobson understands the original charges and penalties and understands that she is entitled to an attorney. Court goes thru waiver of right to attorney, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving her right to an attorney and will allow her to do so. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and 4 and informs the defendant what that means. Defendant pleads NC to count #2. Court amends count #3 to deleting any repeater allegations making it a first offense. Jacobson pleads NC to amended count #3. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and willingly waives her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - submits the form in regards to meeting with the defendant without an attorney present - makes final argument prior to sentencing - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months on each count, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no entry into any bars or taverns, costs on each count - follow joint recommendation. Jacobson understands that this is a joint recommendation and is willing to accept it but otherwise does not make a statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, costs on each count - take bond posted - refund remainder to poster, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Felicia M Jacobson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:18 AM. Jacobson has complaint. Court previously read charges and penalties. State believes that the defendant originally hired Attorney Joy but he has a conflict with the case. Jacobson informs the Court that when she called for a court date, she inquired about court appointed attorney and does not qualify for SPD. Court does not believe the defendant would be eligible for court appointed due to husband's income but gives the defendant the paperwork for court appointed counsel. Courts sets for another AIA. Court - bond - $1100.00 cash and court willing to release some of that money for an attorney if the poster doesn't object.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Felicia M Jacobson not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:53 AM. Court puts on the record that the weather is not good today and road conditions are bad. State informs Court that the Clerks office received a call from someone that the defendant is currently incarcerated in Brown County Jail. State asks for warrant, body or $1100.00. Court so orders.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Felicia M Jacobson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:21 AM. Jacobson handed complaint in Court. Court reads charges ad penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Felicia states that Attorney Joy will be representing her as well. After further discussion, Court not sure if Joy can represent this defendant if he is representing the co-defendant and another co-defendant. Court continues bond and sets this matter for AIA. Jacobson to inform Jeff Joy of court date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
